thread.title: Artistic astronaut breaks record for longest time spent in space and here are some of his best pictures
thread.title_full: Artistic astronaut breaks record for longest time spent in space and here are some of his best pictures - Mirror Online

author: Jeff Parsons
title: Artistic astronaut breaks record for longest time spent in space and here are some of his best pictures
text:
Commander Scott Kelly has broken the record for the most cumulative days in space after clocking up over 383 aboard the International Space Station .
The 51-year-old astronaut is just over halfway through a year-long mission examining how extended time in space affects humans physically and mentally.
During his time in orbit, Kelly has been prolific on Twitter. The former Navy captain has posted a series of amazing pictures of Earth from his unique vantage point.
He marked his record with an encouraging tweet stating that his record will be broken when humans eventually journey to Mars.
Records are meant to be broken. Look fwd to one of my colleagues surpassing my end 500+ days on our #JourneyToMars ! https://t.co/6SrbC8kIBP
— Scott Kelly (@StationCDRKelly) October 16, 2015 Kelly is scheduled to return to Earth on March 3, 2016 after a total of 522 days in space.
The previous record was held by NASA's Mike Fincke who notched up 382 days.
Kelly's identical twin brother Mark is also an astronaut and is also being monitored by NASA .
After Kelly returns to Earth, his health will be compared to that of his brother to determine how space travel has affected him.
Astronaut Scott Kelly in training for a year aboard the ISS
"This is a chance in a lifetime," said Dr Craig Kundrot, the deputy chief scientist at NASA's Human Research Program.
"In this case we've got two genetically identical individuals and we can monitor what kind of changes occur in Mark in an ordinary lifestyle and compare those to the changes that we see in Scott."
Meanwhile, Kelly's space-based social media antics have gained him over 510,000 followers on Twitter and over 375,000 on Instagram.
Here are some of his amazing shots :
@StationCDRKelly/Twitter Image posted by Scott Kelly on the International Space Station showing how North Korea has few lights compared to the countries around it
REUTERS/NASA/Handout NASA Astronaut Scott Kelly captured an aurora from the International Space Station
REUTERS/NASA/Handout NASA Astronaut Scott Kelly captured an aurora from the International Space Station
Twitter/@StationCDRKelly This is one of many landscape shots Cmdr Kelly has captured
Twitter/Scott Kelly Astronaut Scott Kelly tweets amazing picture of red northern lights
Twitter/@StationCDRKelly The Earth looks amazing in this picture from the ISS
